title: Osteoporosis Case Study: Mrs. Thompson
clinical_history: Mrs. Thompson is a 72-year-old retired librarian who was diagnosed with osteoporosis 5 years ago. She has been experiencing back pain and stiffness, particularly in her thoracic and lumbar spine. She reports a gradual onset of pain over the past year, which has worsened over time. She has a history of fractures, including a compression fracture in her thoracic spine 2 years ago.
aggrevating_factors: prolonged standing, bending, lifting, and walking long distances
picture: thoracic and lumbar spine X-ray showing vertebral compression fractures and decreased bone density
easing_factors: rest, heat therapy, and pain medication
past_history: history of fractures, including a compression fracture in her thoracic spine 2 years ago, hysterectomy 10 years ago
medications: alendronate, calcium, and vitamin D supplements, lisinopril, and atorvastatin
personal_history: married with two children, enjoys gardening and reading, but has had to reduce activities due to pain and fear of fractures
imaging: thoracic and lumbar spine X-ray, DEXA scan showing decreased bone density
